description.body: Clubfinder.us is a listing platform designed to match users with Private Clubs and Golf Courses that meet their needs. I worked as the primary developer for ClubFinder ~6 months. Deployed and managed in AWS.
sub_points: Representing 400+ clubs in California
Custom Content management system allows Club Managers to create, customize, and maintain their profiles.
Email server with automated notifications allows Club Managers to communicate to prospective customers through the application.

detail.body: React front end with Node/Express REST API. Deployed and Managed in AWS. Using S3 as data storage (~2000 images).
sub_points: Horizontally scaled and load balanced with Nginx
Managing user data with BCrypt, and JWT validation.
Automated image crushing improves load times

description.body: Outspoke.io provides both buyers and sellers with a platform to interact and list their products. I worked with OutSpoke.io for 2 months developing the product listing service and transition to a Node/React environment.
sub_points: React/Node development connected to existing PHP API
Developed search platform to query, filter, and display products.
User session management (product platform is members only)

detail.body: Worked alongside existing team to migrate from PHP Static Server
sub_points: Deployed with AWS Elastic Beanstalk
Session management with JWT
Google API for location based searching

name: CADL (CAD Library)

description.body: Designed and built CADL as an open source library for CAD files. Users can style and edit their 3D models in browser, create instructions, and share their designs.
sub_points: CADL uses three.js and a custom built file switcher to interpret and render a large variety of filetypes.
Currently supporting: .STL, .SVG, GCODE, .FBX, .DXF
GUI allows users to scale/position/color models, as well as lighting, skybox, and environment effects.
Files are stored in AWS S3, and S3 Glacier to minimize storage costs on large / seldomly accessed files.
Enginx Load balancer
Currently supporting: .STL, .SVG, GCODE, .FBX, .DXF

detail_link_title: Try out the file viewer here:

description.body: A joint project for the annual SF Robitic bartender competition, iZac is a fully functional bar with
sub_points: 190 drink options (although some of those would be terrible)
React UI on Raspberry Pi Toucscreen
Using combination of Air Pressure and peristaltic pumps to control drink level.

detail.body: React / Node / Python running on a Rasberry Pi 4. The react UI calls a Node API which handles bottle stats, and calls a Python microservice to control pins.
sub_points: PostgreSQL database using sequelize ORM
Tracks bottle fill level and adjusts pressure to equalize pour volumes
Lots of welding and woodworking as well

description.body: Landing page for Trucking / Demolition client. This is serverless application.
sub_points: Optimized SEO and location based advertisements through Google Ads
Uses Mailgun API to manage outgoing mail.

description.body: My portfolio page. You know. The page that you are on now.
sub_points: Made to be easy to fork and provide your own content. Check out the repo for instructions on cloning this page.
Page detail is populated via a single JSON document that can be quickly edited to add your own projects.

detail.body: React Front end with a Node/Express server. Project details and images are all mapped from a central JSON file, making it easy to edit or upload new projects.
sub_points: AWS Deployed using Nginx Load balancer
S3 Image storage
Minimal dependencies (other than react) and vanilla CSS

description.body: Plotting your optimal PubCrawl using Google GeoLocation API and Yelp API
sub_points: 24 Hour Hackathon project

detail.body: Future Plans: refactor this page into a react native application to take advantage of GeoFencing capabilities
